summary: WHEN THE OUTSIDE TEMPERATURE IS APPROXIMATELY 35 DEGREES F OR LESS, THERE IS A STRONG RAW FUEL SMELL IN THE VEHICLE FROM COLD STARTUP.  THE PROBLEM DISSIPATES AFTER THE VEHICLE COMES UP TO OPERATING TEMPERATURE.  MECHANIC DIAGNOSED IT AS A LEAKING FUEL LINE UNDER THE INTAKE MANIFOLD.  THE COST OF THIS REPAIR IS APPROXIMATELY $700.  THIS ISSUE APPEARS TO BE COMMON IN BOTH  THE SAAB 9-2X AND ITS SUBARU EQUIVALENT, THE IMPREZA WRX.  BOTH MODELS WERE BUILT BY SUBARU.  THERE WAS A RECALL FOR THE 2002 AND 2003 SUBARU WRX, BUT NOTHING HAS BEEN ISSUED REGARDING THIS VEHICLE.  *TR
